intro: Tarenna lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforest canopy. Tarenna lanceolata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional medicinal uses in local communities.
